com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapPolyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.common.ViewObject
      • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapObject
        • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapPolyline

  • public final class MapPolyline
extends MapObject
    A graphical representation of a GeoPolyline that can be rendered on a map. A MapPolyline has multiple points that combine to create its path.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MapPolyline.CapStyle
      MapPolyline.CapStyle represents line ending cap rendering styles.
      static class  MapPolyline.PatternStyle
      MapPolyline.PatternStyle represents available patterns styles for Line or Border.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapObject

        MapObject.Type

        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.

      • getGeoPolyline

        public GeoPolyline getGeoPolyline()
        Gets copy of the GeoPolyline rendered by this MapPolyline.
        Returns:
        rendered GeoPolyline.

      • isGeodesicEnabled

        public boolean isGeodesicEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether each segment of this GeoPolyline is drawn as a geodesic. By default, GeoDesic is disabled.
        Returns:
        true if GeoPolyline segments are drawn as a geodesic, false otherwise.

      • setGeodesicEnabled

        public MapPolyline setGeodesicEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set whether to draw each segment of the represented GeoPolyline as a geodesic.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if GeoPolyline segments will be drawn as a geodesic
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.

      • enableShadow

        public MapPolyline enableShadow(int width,
                                float shearFactor)
        Enables shadow for this MapPolyline.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the shadow in pixels.
        shearFactor - the coefficient of changing shifting the shadow from the polyline by X axis depending of tilt.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or shear factor is below zero.
        See Also:
        MapPolyline.setShadowColor(int), MapPolyline.disableShadow(), MapPolyline.setShadowOffsets(float, float), MapPolyline.setShadowShearFactor(float), MapPolyline.setShadowSizeIncrement(float)

      • disableShadow

        public MapPolyline disableShadow()
        Disables shadow for this MapPolyline.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.

      • isShadowEnabled

        public boolean isShadowEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the shadow is enabled for this MapPolyline or not.
        Returns:
        True if shadow is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setShadowOffsets

        public MapPolyline setShadowOffsets(float offsetX,
                                    float offsetY)
        Sets shadow's offsets.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - shifting the shadow from the polyline by X axis in pixels.
        offsetY - shifting the shadow from the polyline by Y axis in pixels.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if offsetX or offsetY is below zero.

      • setShadowSizeIncrement

        public MapPolyline setShadowSizeIncrement(float sizeIncrement)

        Parameters:
        sizeIncrement - coefficient of the polyline`s shadow width changing.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sizeIncrement is below zero.

      • getShadowWidth

        public int getShadowWidth()

      • setShadowColor

        public MapPolyline setShadowColor(int color)
        Sets a shadow color for this MapPolyline, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. The default line color is Color.BLUE.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255] with 0 meaning no contribution for that component, and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getShadowColor

        public int getShadowColor()
        Gets the current shadow color for this MapPolyline, returning an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setLineColor

        public MapPolyline setLineColor(int color)
        Sets a line color for this MapPolyline, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. The default line color is Color.BLUE.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255] with 0 meaning no contribution for that component, and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getLineColor

        public int getLineColor()
        Gets the current line color for this MapPolyline, returning an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setLineWidth

        public MapPolyline setLineWidth(int width)
        Sets a line width, in pixels, for this MapPolyline, an int value within the [0..100] range. By default, the line width is 1.
        Parameters:
        width - Desired width of the line defining the MapPolyline.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is width is out of range.

      • getLineWidth

        public int getLineWidth()
        Returns the current line width for this MapPolyline, in pixels.
        Returns:
        The current line width for this MapPolyline.

      • isDashEnabled

        @Deprecated
public boolean isDashEnabled()
        Deprecated. out of SDK version 3.9 please use MapPolyline.getCustomPattern() with MapPolyline.PatternStyle.DASH_PATTERN.
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the MapPolyline appears as a dashed line. By default, dash is disabled.
        Returns:
        True if the MapPolyline is dashed, false otherwise.

      • setDashEnabled

        @Deprecated
public MapPolyline setDashEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Deprecated. out of SDK version 3.9 please use MapPolyline.setCustomPattern(com.here.android.mpa.common.Image) with MapPolyline.PatternStyle.DASH_PATTERN.
        Sets the appearance of this MapPolyline as either a dashed or solid line.
        Parameters:
        enabled - A boolean specifying whether the MapPolyline should be dashed.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.

      • getDashPrimaryLength

        public int getDashPrimaryLength()
        Returns the current length of the primary dash segment of a dashed MapPolyline, in pixels.
        Returns:
        The current length of the primary dash.
        See Also:
        MapPolyline.getDashSecondaryLength()

      • setDashPrimaryLength

        public MapPolyline setDashPrimaryLength(int length)
        Sets a length, in pixels, for the primary dash segment of a dashed MapPolyline. By default, the primary dash length is 1.
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of the primary dash
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is less than or equal to 0.
        See Also:
        MapPolyline.setDashSecondaryLength(int)

      • isExtrusionEnabled

        public boolean isExtrusionEnabled()
        Returns status of extrusion is it enabled or not. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        true if extrusion enabled, false otherwise.

      • setExtrusionEnabled

        public MapPolyline setExtrusionEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Turns extrusion flag ON/OFF. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Used to turn option ON (true) of OFF (false).
        Returns:
        self reference for convenience.

      • getDashSecondaryLength

        public int getDashSecondaryLength()
        Returns the current length of the secondary (empty) dash segments of a dashed MapPolyline, in pixels.
        Returns:
        The current length of the empty dash.
        See Also:
        MapPolyline.getDashPrimaryLength().

      • setDashSecondaryLength

        public MapPolyline setDashSecondaryLength(int length)
        Sets a length, in pixels, for the secondary (empty) dash segments of a dashed MapPolyline. By default, the secondary dash length is 1.
        Parameters:
        length - Desired length of the empty dash.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is less than or equal 0.
        See Also:
        MapPolyline.setDashPrimaryLength(int)

        CapStyle cap style.

      • setDepthTestEnabled

        public void setDepthTestEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set whether to render MapPolyline with depth test.

        Rendering with depth test should be used if map object altitude is relevant in your application. Rendering objects with different heights while disabling depth test may cause object occlusion.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if MapPolyline is rendered with depth test.

      • getDepthTestEnabled

        public boolean getDepthTestEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the MapPolyline is rendered with depth test. By default, depth test is disabled.
        Returns:
        True if the MapPolyline is rendered with depth test, false otherwise.

      • setOutlineColor

        public MapPolyline setOutlineColor(int color)
        Sets an outline color for this MapPolyline, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. The default line color is Color.TRANSPARENT.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255] with 0 meaning no contribution for that component, and 255 meaning 100% contribution
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getOutlineColor

        public int getOutlineColor()
        Gets the current outline color for this MapPolyline, returning an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setOutlineWidth

        public MapPolyline setOutlineWidth(int width)
        Sets an outline width, in pixels, for this MapPolyline, an int value within the [0..100] range. By default, the line width is 0.
        Parameters:
        width - Desired width of the outline defining the MapPolyline.
        Returns:
        The updated MapPolyline itself.
        Throws:
        {@link - IllegalArgumentException} if width is out of range.

      • getOutlineWidth

        public int getOutlineWidth()
        Returns the current outline width for this MapPolyline, in pixels.
        Returns:
        The current line width for child of MapPolyline.

      • isPerspectiveEnabled

        public boolean isPerspectiveEnabled()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the MapPolyline appears thinner further away when the map is tilted. By default, perspective is disabled. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        true if the MapPolyline has perspective enabled, false otherwise.

      • setPerspectiveEnabled

        public MapPolyline setPerspectiveEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the width of this MapPolyline to be thinner further away when the map is tilted. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        enabled - A boolean specifying whether the MapPolyline should have perspective enabled.
        Returns:
        The updated child of MapPolyline itself.

      • setPatternStyle

        public MapPolyline setPatternStyle(MapPolyline.PatternStyle style)
        Sets new patter style for line/border. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        style - one of MapPolyline.PatternStyle available.
        Returns:
        The updated child of MapPolyline itself.

      • getPatternStyle

        public MapPolyline.PatternStyle getPatternStyle()
        Method retrieves current pattern of line/border. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        current MapPolyline.PatternStyle value.

      • setCustomPattern

        public MapPolyline setCustomPattern(Image icon)
        Specifies patter image. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        icon - image to be used as pattern, it is recommended to use icons with dimensions which are pow of 2.
        Returns:
        The updated child of MapPolyline itself.

      • getCustomPattern

        public final Image getCustomPattern()
        Returns pattern image. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Returns:
        Image object with previously user defined pattern.
